cards.name: Lord of the Pit
cards.text:
Flying, trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature other than Lord of the Pit. If you can't, Lord of the Pit deals 7 damage to you.

rulings.text: If you control any other creatures as Lord of the Pit's triggered ability resolves, you must sacrifice one. You can't choose to be dealt 7 damage instead.

If Lord of the Pit has gained lifelink, being dealt 7 damage by it doesn't cause your life total to change, even though you gain and lose life. If your life total is less than 7, you won't lose the game.
If you have two Lords of the Pit, you can sacrifice them to each other.

cards.originalText:
Flying, trample (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach. If this creature would deal enough combat damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it deal the rest of its damage to defending player.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature other than Lord of the Pit. If you can't, Lord of the Pit deals 7 damage to you.

cards.name: Lord of the Undead
cards.text:
Other Zombie creatures get +1/+1.
{1}{B}, {T}: Return target Zombie card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: "Do not weep at your defeat, my dear. In death, you will serve a greater purpose—mine."

rulings.text: Lord of the Undead now has the Zombie creature type and its first ability has been reworded to affect *other* Zombies. This means that if two Lord of the Undead are on the battlefield, each gives the other a bonus.

cards.originalText:
Other Zombie creatures get +1/+1.
{1}{B}, {T}: Return target Zombie card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Mass of Ghouls
cards.flavor:
"An army has filled the valley, but it's not like any army I've ever seen. There are no tents, no fires, no horses . . . just a sea of bodies, writhing and moaning, as if a pestilent village were sent to invade us."
—Onean scout

cards.name: Megrim
cards.text: Whenever an opponent discards a card, Megrim deals 2 damage to that player.
cards.flavor:
"Pain is both a tool and a craft. Like any tool, it must be sharpened. Like any craft, it must be practiced."
—Hooks, Cabal torturer
cards.originalText: Whenever an opponent discards a card, Megrim deals 2 damage to that player.

cards.name: Midnight Ritual
cards.text: Exile X target creature cards from your graveyard. For each creature card exiled this way, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.
cards.flavor: Bury old friends deeply, lest they return bearing worms.
cards.originalText: Remove X target creature cards in your graveyard from the game. For each creature card removed this way, put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token into play.

cards.name: Mind Rot
cards.text: Target player discards two cards.
cards.flavor:
"The beauty of mental attacks is that your victims never remember them."
—Volrath
cards.originalText: Target player discards two cards.

cards.name: Mortal Combat
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if twenty or more creature cards are in your graveyard, you win the game.
cards.flavor: The crowd roared, the fighters bled, and the dead piled high in the pits. Only the Cabal could win.

rulings.text: If you don't have twenty or more creature cards in your graveyard by the time your upkeep starts, the ability won't trigger that turn.

Mortal Combat's ability has an "intervening 'if' clause," so the condition is checked again when the triggered ability resolves. If you don't still have twenty creature cards in your graveyard, the ability does nothing.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, if twenty or more creature cards are in your graveyard, you win the game.

cards.name: Mortivore
cards.text:
Mortivore's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in all graveyards.
{B}: Regenerate Mortivore.
cards.flavor: The light sigh of its breath whistles through its bones.
cards.originalText:
Mortivore's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in all graveyards.
{B}: Regenerate Mortivore. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

cards.name: Nantuko Husk
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature: Nantuko Husk gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
The soul sheds light, and death is its shadow. When the light dims, life and death embrace.
—Nantuko teaching

rulings.text: You can sacrifice Nantuko Husk itself to activate its own ability. However, the only thing that will do is put Nantuko Husk into the graveyard.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice a creature: Nantuko Husk gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Nekrataal
cards.text:
First strike
When Nekrataal enters the battlefield, destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. That creature can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: His victims don't have time to feel despair.

rulings.text: Nothing happens if there are no nonartifact, nonblack creatures on the battlefield when Nekrataal enters the battlefield, but if there is one, you must target it, even if it's a creature you control.

cards.originalText:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
When Nekrataal comes into play, destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. That creature can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Nightmare
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.
cards.flavor: The thunder of its hooves beats dreams into despair.

rulings.text: If you control 0 swamps, then the Nightmare has 0 toughness and will be put into its owner's graveyard as a state-based action right before the next player gains priority.
Nightmare's power and toughness changes as the number of Swamps you control changes.
The ability that defines Nightmare's power and toughness works everywhere, not just on the battlefield.
Nightmare's ability counts all lands you control with the subtype Swamp, not just ones named Swamp.

cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.

cards.name: No Rest for the Wicked
cards.text: Sacrifice No Rest for the Wicked: Return to your hand all creature cards in your graveyard that were put there from the battlefield this turn.
cards.flavor:
"The soul? Here, we have no use for such frivolities."
—Sitrik, birth priest

rulings.text: It doesn't matter who controlled the creature cards when they were on the battlefield. As long as they were put into your graveyard, you get to put them into your hand.

If you sacrifice No Rest for the Wicked on the same turn you cast it, all creature cards that were put into your graveyard from the battlefield that turn will be returned to your hand, including any that were put into your graveyard before No Rest for the Wicked entered the battlefield.

foreignNames.name: Pas de repos pour les braves
No hay reposo para los malvados

cards.originalText: Sacrifice No Rest for the Wicked: Return to your hand all creature cards that were put into your graveyard from play this turn.

cards.name: Phage the Untouchable
cards.text:
When Phage the Untouchable enters the battlefield, if you didn't cast it from your hand, you lose the game.
Whenever Phage deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature. It can't be regenerated.
Whenever Phage deals combat damage to a player, that player loses the game.

rulings.text: It is only considered "cast from your hand" if you cast it as a spell from your hand. Putting it onto the battlefield from your hand using a spell or ability will cause you to lose the game.
In a Commander game where this card is your commander, casting it from the Command zone does not count as casting it from your hand.

foreignNames.name: 触れられざる者フェイジ

cards.originalText:
When Phage the Untouchable comes into play, if you didn't play it from your hand, you lose the game. 
Whenever Phage deals combat damage to a creature, destroy that creature. It can't be regenerated. 
Whenever Phage deals combat damage to a player, that player loses the game.

cards.name: Phyrexian Rager
cards.text: When Phyrexian Rager enters the battlefield, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
cards.flavor: It takes no prisoners, but it keeps the choicest bits for Phyrexia.

foreignNames.name: ファイレクシアの憤怒鬼

cards.originalText: When Phyrexian Rager comes into play, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.

cards.name: Plague Beetle
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavor: No one knows whether they were named for the disease they carry or for the speed at which they multiply.
cards.originalText: Swampwalk (This creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

cards.name: Plague Wind
cards.text: Destroy all creatures you don't control. They can't be regenerated.
cards.originalText: Destroy all creatures you don't control. They can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Rain of Tears
cards.text: Destroy target land.
cards.flavor:
"When mortals die, they have family, friends, compatriots to mourn them. When the land dies, all else dies with it, and there is no one left to weep."
—Jacinth, Skyshroud ranger
cards.originalText: Destroy target land.

cards.name: Ravenous Rats
cards.text: When Ravenous Rats enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.
cards.flavor: Nothing is sacred to rats. Everything is simply another meal.
cards.originalText: When Ravenous Rats comes into play, target opponent discards a card.

cards.name: Recover
cards.text:
Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor: As Barrin exhumed his daughter's body, he finally realized the full price of his faith in Urza.
cards.originalText:
Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Relentless Rats
cards.text:
Relentless Rats gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield named Relentless Rats.
A deck can have any number of cards named Relentless Rats.

rulings.text: The second ability of Relentless Rats lets you ignore the "four-of" rule. It doesn't let you ignore format legality. For example, during a Masters 25 Limited event, you can't add Relentless Rats from your personal collection.

cards.originalText:
Relentless Rats gets +1/+1 for each other creature in play named Relentless Rats.
A deck can have any number of cards named Relentless Rats.

cards.name: Royal Assassin
cards.text: {T}: Destroy target tapped creature.
cards.flavor: Trained in the arts of stealth, royal assassins choose their victims carefully, relying on timing and precision rather than brute force.

rulings.text: Can't target itself because you choose the target before you tap him. At that time he is not yet a legal target.
If the creature is no longer tapped when the Assassin's ability resolves, then the ability doesn't resolve.

cards.originalText: {T}: Destroy target tapped creature.

cards.name: Scathe Zombies
cards.flavor:
"They groaned, they stirred, they all uprose,
Nor spake, nor moved their eyes;
It had been strange, even in a dream,
To have seen those dead men rise."
—Samuel Taylor Coleridge,
"The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

cards.name: Sengir Vampire
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Vampire this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.
cards.flavor: Empires rise and fall, but evil is eternal.

rulings.text: If Sengir Vampire deals nonlethal damage to a creature and then a different effect or damage source causes that creature to be put into a graveyard later in the turn, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger and it will get a +1/+1 counter.

Each time a creature is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, check whether Sengir Vampire had dealt any damage to it at any time during that turn. If so, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger. It doesn't matter who controlled the creature or whose graveyard it was put into.
If Sengir Vampire and a creature it dealt damage to are both put into a graveyard at the same time, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger, but it will do nothing when it resolves.

cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Vampire this turn is put into a graveyard, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.

cards.name: Severed Legion
cards.text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
cards.flavor: No one in Aphetto answers a knock at the door after sundown.
cards.originalText: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)

cards.name: Sleeper Agent
cards.text:
When Sleeper Agent enters the battlefield, target opponent gains control of it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, Sleeper Agent deals 2 damage to you.

rulings.text: This card is a bit weird. When it enters the battlefield under your control, you give control of it to an opponent. After that it damages them each turn because the "you" on the card means its controller.

cards.originalText:
When Sleeper Agent comes into play, target opponent gains control of it. 
At the beginning of your upkeep, Sleeper Agent deals 2 damage to you.

cards.name: Soul Feast
cards.text: Target player loses 4 life and you gain 4 life.
cards.flavor:
"I smell the tang of a mortal's fresh blood. I hear it sliding wetly beneath its skin. My hunger cannot refuse the invitation."
—Yuri, Sengir vampire
cards.originalText: Target player loses 4 life and you gain 4 life.

cards.name: Spineless Thug
cards.text: Spineless Thug can't block.
cards.flavor: What it lacks in backbone, it makes up for in cruelty.
cards.originalText: Spineless Thug can't block.

cards.name: Stronghold Discipline
cards.text: Each player loses 1 life for each creature they control.
cards.flavor: In Urborg, the instigators of each new rebellion are soaked in the blood of the last.
cards.originalText: Each player loses 1 life for each creature he or she controls.

cards.name: Terror
cards.text: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.originalText: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Thrull Surgeon
cards.text: {1}{B}, Sacrifice Thrull Surgeon: Look at target player's hand and choose a card from it. That player discards that card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
cards.flavor: "Just take a little off the top."
cards.originalText: {1}{B}, Sacrifice Thrull Surgeon: Look at target player's hand and choose a card from it. That player discards that card. Play this ability only any time you could play a sorcery.

cards.name: Underworld Dreams
cards.text: Whenever an opponent draws a card, Underworld Dreams deals 1 damage to that player.
cards.flavor:
"In the drowsy dark cave of the mind, dreams build their nest with fragments dropped from day's caravan."
—Rabindranath Tagore

rulings.text: If multiple cards are drawn at once, this card triggers once for each card drawn.
In a multi-player game, it affects all opponents.

cards.originalText: Whenever an opponent draws a card, Underworld Dreams deals 1 damage to him or her.

cards.name: Unholy Strength
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1.
cards.flavor: Such power grows the body as it shrinks the soul.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +2/+1.

cards.name: Vampire Bats
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{B}: Vampire Bats gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability no more than twice each turn.
cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{B}: Vampire Bats gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Play this ability no more than twice each turn.

cards.name: Anaba Bodyguard
cards.text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
cards.flavor:
"They who challenge a minotaur enjoy the taste of their own blood."
—Mirri of the Weatherlight

foreignNames.name: アナーバのボディガード

cards.originalText: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

cards.name: Arcane Teachings
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to any target."
cards.flavor: Not all knowledge is learned from parchment.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and has "{T}: This creature deals 1 damage to target creature or player."

cards.name: Beacon of Destruction
cards.text: Beacon of Destruction deals 5 damage to any target. Shuffle Beacon of Destruction into its owner's library.
cards.flavor: The Great Furnace's blessing is a spectacular sight, but the best view comes at a high cost.

rulings.text: If a Beacon is countered or doesn't resolve, it's put into its owner's graveyard, not shuffled into the library.

cards.originalText: Beacon of Destruction deals 5 damage to target creature or player. Shuffle Beacon of Destruction into its owner's library.

cards.name: Blaze
cards.text: Blaze deals X damage to any target.
cards.originalText: Blaze deals X damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Bloodfire Colossus
cards.text: {R}, Sacrifice Bloodfire Colossus: Bloodfire Colossus deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.flavor: It took all its strength to contain the fire within.
cards.originalText: {R}, Sacrifice Bloodfire Colossus: Bloodfire Colossus deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.name: Bloodrock Cyclops
cards.text: Bloodrock Cyclops attacks each combat if able.
cards.flavor:
"There are only fifty words in the cyclops language, and ten of them mean 'kill.'"
—Ertai

rulings.text: There is no penalty if it can't attack.

foreignNames.name: ブラッドロック・サイクロプス

cards.originalText: Bloodrock Cyclops attacks each turn if able.

cards.name: Bogardan Firefiend
cards.text: When Bogardan Firefiend dies, it deals 2 damage to target creature.
cards.flavor:
"The next one who tells me to relax and curl up by a fire is dead."
—Mirri of the Weatherlight

rulings.text: You must pick a target creature, even if you are the only player with creatures on the battlefield.

cards.originalText: When Bogardan Firefiend is put into a graveyard from play, it deals 2 damage to target creature.

cards.name: Cone of Flame
cards.text: Cone of Flame deals 1 damage to any target, 2 damage to another target, and 3 damage to a third target.

rulings.text: Each of the three targets must be different. If there aren't three different legal targets available, you can't cast the spell.
If one or two of Cone of Flame's targets are illegal when it resolves, you can't change how much damage will be dealt to the remaining legal targets.

cards.originalText: Cone of Flame deals 1 damage to target creature or player, 2 damage to another target creature or player, and 3 damage to a third target creature or player.

cards.name: Cryoclasm
cards.text: Destroy target Plains or Island. Cryoclasm deals 3 damage to that land's controller.
cards.flavor: The people of Terisiare had come to live on frozen fields as though on solid ground. Nothing reminded them of the difference more clearly than the rifts brought on by the Thaw.
cards.originalText: Destroy target Plains or Island. Cryoclasm deals 3 damage to that land's controller.

cards.name: Demolish
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or land.
cards.flavor:
"Pound the steel until it fits.
Doesn't work? Bash to bits."
—Dwarven forging song
cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact or land.

cards.name: Dragon Roost
cards.text: {5}{R}{R}: Create a 5/5 red Dragon creature token with flying. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: Dragons erupt from peaks of chaos and flow from rivers of molten rage.
cards.originalText: {5}{R}{R}: Put a 5/5 red Dragon creature token with flying into play. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

cards.name: Duct Crawler
cards.text: {1}{R}: Target creature can't block Duct Crawler this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Boss told us to try and train 'em. Trained it to attack—it ate Flugg. Trained it to run fast—it got away. Success!"
—Dlig, goblin spelunker
cards.originalText: {1}{R}: Target creature can't block Duct Crawler this turn.

cards.name: Earth Elemental
cards.flavor: Earth elementals have the eternal strength of stone and the endurance of mountains. Primordially connected to the land they inhabit, they take a long-term view of things, scorning the impetuous haste of short-lived mortal creatures.

cards.name: Firebreathing
cards.text:
Enchant creature
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Cradle your rage close to your heart and nurture your grudge with hatred that you may unleash upon your foes a dragon's fury."
—Tomor, dragonspeaker shaman

rulings.text: This ability can be activated by Firebreathing's controller, not the enchanted creature's controller (in case they're different players).
The ability affects whichever creature is enchanted by Firebreathing at the time the ability resolves. The bonus remains even if Firebreathing stops enchanting that creature.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you play this. This card comes into play attached to that creature.)
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Fists of the Anvil
cards.text: Target creature gets +4/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Gron's mind reeled with possibilities, most of which are best left unmentioned.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +4/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Flamewave Invoker
cards.text: {7}{R}: Flamewave Invoker deals 5 damage to target player or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: Inside even the humblest goblin lurks the potential for far greater things—and far worse.
cards.originalText: {7}{R}: Flamewave Invoker deals 5 damage to target player.

cards.name: Flowstone Slide
cards.text: All creatures get +X/-X until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Like an avalanche. With teeth. That will chase you. Uphill."
—Flint Foot, viashino runner
cards.originalText: All creatures get +X/-X until end of turn.

cards.name: Furnace of Rath
cards.text: If a source would deal damage to a permanent or player, it deals double that damage to that permanent or player instead.
cards.flavor: The furnace awaits the next master who would stoke the fires of apocalypse.

rulings.text: If a spell or ability damages multiple things, divide up the damage before applying this effect. This means you can't normally end up with an odd amount of damage on something.
The trample rules cause damage to be divided before it is doubled.
If you have two of these on the battlefield, the damage is multiplied by 4.
The multiplied damage counts in all ways as if it came from the original source. Furnace of Rath is not the source.

If multiple effects modify how damage will be dealt, the player who would be dealt damage or the controller of the creature that would be dealt damage chooses the order to apply the effects. For example, Mending Hands says, "Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn." Suppose a spell would deal 5 damage to a player who has cast Mending Hands targeting themselves. That player can either (a) prevent 4 damage first and then let Furnace of Rath double the remaining 1 damage, taking 2 damage, or (b) double the damage to 10 and then prevent 4 damage, taking 6 damage.

cards.originalText: If a source would deal damage to a creature or player, it deals double that damage to that creature or player instead.

cards.name: Furnace Whelp
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{R}: Furnace Whelp gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Baby dragons can't figure out humans—if they didn't want to be killed, why were they made of meat and treasure?
cards.originalText:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{R}: Furnace Whelp gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Goblin Elite Infantry
cards.text: Whenever Goblin Elite Infantry blocks or becomes blocked, it gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: They talk a good fight.

foreignNames.name: ゴブリン精鋭歩兵部隊

cards.originalText: Whenever Goblin Elite Infantry blocks or becomes blocked, it gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Goblin King
cards.text: Other Goblin creatures get +1/+1 and have mountainwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
cards.flavor: To be king, Numsgil did in Blog, who did in Unkful, who did in Viddle, who did in Loll, who did in Alrok. . . .

rulings.text: Goblin King now has the Goblin creature type and its ability has been reworded to affect *other* Goblins. This means that if two Goblin Kings are on the battlefield, each gives the other a bonus.

cards.originalText: Other Goblin creatures get +1/+1 and have mountainwalk. (They're unblockable as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)

cards.name: Goblin Lore
cards.text: Draw four cards, then discard three cards at random.
cards.flavor: "Now listen closely, my young gob. There are many ways to eat pimple bugs, but I say the best way is all smashed together between two slug chips."
cards.originalText: Draw four cards, then discard three cards at random.

cards.name: Goblin Piker
cards.flavor: Once he'd worked out which end of the thing was sharp, he was promoted to guard duty.

cards.name: Goblin Sky Raider
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: The goblin word for "flying" is more accurately translated as "falling slowly."
cards.originalText: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

cards.name: Guerrilla Tactics
cards.text:
Guerrilla Tactics deals 2 damage to any target.
When a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard Guerrilla Tactics, Guerrilla Tactics deals 4 damage to any target.

rulings.text: If it is discarded, the damage done by it is done by this card due to an ability and not by a spell.
The second ability will trigger even on an optional discard caused by an opponent.
Discarding as a cost to cast a spell will not trigger the ability. Only discarding as an effect will trigger the ability.

cards.originalText:
Guerrilla Tactics deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
When a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard Guerrilla Tactics, Guerrilla Tactics deals 4 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Hill Giant
cards.flavor: Fortunately, hill giants have large blind spots in which a human can easily hide. Unfortunately, these blind spots are beneath the bottoms of their feet.

cards.name: Incinerate
cards.text: Incinerate deals 3 damage to any target. A creature dealt damage this way can't be regenerated this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Yes, I think 'toast' is an appropriate description."
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

rulings.text: Regeneration abilities that would affect that creature can still be activated; they just won't do anything. The creature can't be regenerated for any reason, even if an effect other than Incinerate would deal lethal damage to it or otherwise destroy it.

cards.originalText: Incinerate deals 3 damage to target creature or player. A creature dealt damage this way can't be regenerated this turn.

cards.name: Kamahl, Pit Fighter
cards.text:
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
{T}: Kamahl, Pit Fighter deals 3 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: In times when freedom seems lost, great souls arise to reclaim it.

rulings.text: The Legend rule only applies to two legendary permanents with identical names. If the names are different, even if they depict the same character, the rule does not apply.

foreignNames.name: ピット・ファイター、カマール

cards.originalText:
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
{T}: Kamahl, Pit Fighter deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Lava Axe
cards.text: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: "Catch!"
cards.originalText: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player.

cards.name: Lavaborn Muse
cards.text: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, if that player has two or fewer cards in hand, Lavaborn Muse deals 3 damage to that player.
cards.flavor:
"Her voice is disaster, painful and final."
—Matoc, lavamancer

rulings.text: The number of cards in hand is checked both at the beginning of upkeep and when the triggered ability resolves.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of each opponent's upkeep, if that player has two or fewer cards in hand, Lavaborn Muse deals 3 damage to him or her.

cards.name: Lightning Elemental
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
cards.flavor:
"A flash of the lightning, a break of the wave,
He passes from life to his rest in the grave."
—William Knox, "Mortality"
cards.originalText: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)

cards.name: Manabarbs
cards.text: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, Manabarbs deals 1 damage to that player.
cards.flavor:
"I don't know why people say a double-edged sword is bad. It's a sword. With two edges."
—Kamahl, pit fighter

rulings.text: This card has a triggered ability that causes a separate effect for 1 point of damage each time a land is tapped for mana.
This ability is not a mana ability. It goes on the stack and can be responded to.
The ability will trigger each time a land is tapped for mana. Each ability is separate.

If any lands are tapped for mana while a player is casting a spell or activating an ability, Manabarbs's ability will trigger that many times and wait. When the player finishes casting that spell or activating that ability, it's put on the stack, then Manabarbs's triggered abilities are put on the stack on top of it. The Manabarbs abilities will resolve first.

On the other hand, a player can tap lands for mana, let the Manabarbs triggered abilities be put on the stack, and then respond to those abilities by casting an instant or activating an ability using that mana. In that case, the spell or ability will resolve first.

cards.originalText: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, Manabarbs deals 1 damage to that player.

cards.flavor: "I got it! I got it! I—"

rulings.text: Once Mogg Fanatic has dealt and been dealt combat damage, it's too late to activate its ability before it's destroyed.

cards.originalText: Sacrifice Mogg Fanatic: Mogg Fanatic deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Relentless Assault
cards.text: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.
cards.flavor: "Mercy? Mercy is for the playground, not the battleground."

rulings.text: If you manage to cast this during a main phase of your opponent's turn, that opponent's creatures will untap and that opponent will be able to attack again. It will not allow you to attack during their turn.
Abilities that trigger when a creature attacks, blocks, or is blocked will trigger during each combat that turn. Thus, a creature with Rampage will get the bonus added during each attack.
A creature that must attack each turn, must only attack once that turn. It is not forced into each attack that turn.
It only creates an additional combat and main phase if it resolves during a main phase.

cards.originalText: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.

cards.name: Shunt
cards.text: Change the target of target spell with a single target.
cards.flavor: Aranghil held her fury in her heart, hard and bright as a ruby. With its razor edge, she rewrote the laws of battle.

rulings.text: Once the spell resolves, the new target is considered to be targeted by the deflected spell. This will trigger any effects which trigger on being targeted.
This only targets the spell being changed, not the original or new target of the spell it is affecting.
The target of a spell that targets another spell on the stack can be changed to any other spell on the stack, even if the new target will resolve before the spell does.
You can't make a spell which is on the stack target itself.

You can choose to make a spell on the stack target this spell (if such a target choice would be legal had the spell been cast while this spell was on the stack). The new target for the deflected spell is not chosen until this spell resolves. This spell is still on the stack when new targets are selected for the spell.
If there is no other legal target for the spell, this does not change the target.
This does not check if the current target is legal. It just checks if the spell has a single target.
You choose the spell to target on announcement, but you pick the new target for that spell on resolution.
If a spell targets multiple things, you can't target it with Shunt, even if all but one of those targets has become illegal.
If a spell targets the same player or object multiple times, you can't target it with Shunt.

cards.originalText: Change the target of target spell with a single target.

rulings.text: Must be used before blockers are declared in order to affect blocking decisions. You can't wait to see what your opponent declares and then try to stop them.
You can use it after combat or even on a creature which can't possibly block this turn because it's that player's turn to attack, but it generally has no effect other than to let you draw a card.

cards.name: Warp World
cards.text: Each player shuffles all permanents they own into their library, then reveals that many cards from the top of their library. Each player puts all artifact, creature, and land cards revealed this way onto the battlefield, then does the same for enchantment cards, then puts all cards revealed this way that weren't put onto the battlefield on the bottom of their library.

rulings.text: Anything that triggers during the resolution of this will wait to be put on the stack until everything is put onto the battlefield and resolution is complete. The player whose turn it is will put all of their triggered abilities on the stack in any order, then each other player in turn order will do the same. (The last ability put on the stack will be the first one that resolves.)

Taking it slowly, here's what happens when Warp World resolves: 1) Each player counts the number of permanents they own. 2) Each player shuffles those permanents into their library. 3) Each player reveals cards from the top of their library equal to the number that player counted. 4) Each player puts all artifact, land, and creature cards revealed this way onto the battlefield. All of these cards enter the battlefield at the same time. 5) Each player puts all enchantment cards revealed this way onto the battlefield. An Aura put onto the battlefield this way can enchant an artifact, land, or creature that was already put onto the battlefield, but can't enchant an enchantment that's being put onto the battlefield at the same time as it. If multiple players have Auras to put onto the battlefield, the player whose turn it is announces what their Auras will enchant, then each other player in turn order does the same, then all enchantments (both Auras and non-Auras) enter the battlefield at the same time. 6) Each player puts all of their other revealed cards (instants, sorceries, planeswalkers, and Auras that can't enchant anything) on the bottom of their library in any order.

Tokens are permanents but not cards. They'll count toward the number of permanents shuffled into your library, so you'll get a card back for each token you owned. But the tokens themselves should be ignored while you're revealing *cards* from your library. In practice, you shouldn't actually shuffle them into your library since they'll cease to exist as soon as Warp World finishes resolving. Note that a token's owner is the player under whose control it first entered the battlefield.

cards.originalText: Each player shuffles all permanents he or she owns into his or her library, then reveals that many cards from the top of his or her library. Each player puts all artifact, creature, and land cards revealed this way into play, then puts all enchantment cards revealed this way into play, then puts all cards revealed this way that weren't put into play on the bottom of his or her library in any order.

cards.name: Abundance
cards.text: If you would draw a card, you may instead choose land or nonland and reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a card of the chosen kind. Put that card into your hand and put all other cards revealed this way on the bottom of your library in any order.

rulings.text: This replacement effect replaces the draw, so nothing that triggers on a draw will trigger.

If you use this on a multi-card draw, each replaced draw is handled separately. In other words, you reveal and then put on the bottom of the library for the first card, then do the same for the second, and so on. In a multi-card draw you do not have to choose how many of those draws will be replaced before you do any drawing or use of this card.
If no card of the chosen type is found before your library empties, you don't get a card, but you do get to order all the cards in your library any way you choose.

If your library is empty, Abundance can prevent you from losing the game for being unable to draw a card. If an effect or turn-based action would cause you to draw a card, you can replace that draw with Abundance's replacement effect. (It doesn't matter that you'd be unable to actually draw a card.) Since Abundance's effect has you put a card into your hand instead of drawing a card, you'll never be forced to draw a card with an empty library.

cards.originalText: If you would draw a card, you may instead choose land or nonland and reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal a card of the chosen kind. Put that card into your hand and put all other cards revealed this way on the bottom of your library in any order.
